entries.name: inProgress
entries.text: I'm sure it's around here somewhere...

entries.name: notStarted
entries.text: Good day, traveller. Did you have an appointment?

children.name: notStarted2
children.response: *sigh* No one ever does. Still, I'm happy to see you trespassing on my land, because I could use some help.

children.name: proceed
children.response: When I was young, my father gave me an iron axe. He said it was his father's before him. It is now my turn to pass it to my own son, but I can't find it. Can you help me look?

children.name: clue
children.text: Where did you see it last?
children.response: In a barrel, over on the other side of the house.

children.name: reject
children.text: What do we say to the god of death?

children.name: passingThru
children.text: Actually, I'm just passing through. Catchest thou later, my lord.

entries.name: clockAccepted
entries.text: Thank you again for finding my Iron Axe. Was there anything else?

children.name: clockInfo
children.text: Actually, do you know anything about a missing clock? The villagers down there said it's missing and I'm helping them find it.
children.response: I don't know anything about a clock, but a band of theives came through here.

children.name: theives
children.response: Yes. I heard a bit of a ruckus across the river. Bell ringing. People shouting. Then some splashing.

children.name: splashing
children.response: Yeah, down by my docks. I called out to them, "Who are you? Do you have an appointment?" But they just laughed. I saw them put something gold and shiny into a bag, then they ran up to the village end, just south of my manor.

children.name: south
children.response: Yes, those little Blue Nerd houses down there.

children.name: thanks
children.text: Thanks, I'll head that way next.
children.response: You do that. And if you find the rogues, tell them to make an appointment next time!

entries.name: clockNotAccepted
entries.text: Yes, thank you. You were a big help.
